text:
Hi Team, I'm new on HubSpot. I need Swagger of HubSpot APIs.
Any help on this would be appreciated.

Those aren't provided at the moment (HubSpot maintains its own spec online).  Thats sad and its even known there is a specification (e.g. the php client is generated from it), but it doesnt seem to be public.

There is no fast way, you will have to implement an API client yourself.
Ok, thanks <@U014A8JD9DH>
<@U014A8JD9DH> is there any API which gave us fields?
Please clarify this. What are fields?
I mean, is their any api which gives me meta data for all the objects?
Nope.
Are you sure?
Yes.
You will have to read the api manually.
I searched for sth like that a lot in the past.
Okay thanks.

Hey <@U014A8JD9DH>, I think the Swagger(meta data)  are public.
I found one <https://api.hubapi.com/api-catalog/v0/apis/extensions/v1/ecomm/>
Never seen that before, but thats only the e-commerce bridge as it seems?
Yes right.
Is  there anyone/Channel from HubSpot side from which we can get help on this?
Hey  <@U014A8JD9DH>, do we have postman collection available for HubSpot?
I only have a private one, but thats very specific and for my own developments. I might share it when its a little more configurable and feature complete :confused:
Hi team, Is it possible to add canonical tag to the template using HubSpot variables. I am new to HubSpot and am not sure if this does make sense

you should be able to use the `{{page_meta.canonical_url}}` or `{{canonical_url}}` variable and that will pull the URL for it. I would recommend checking out the developer info to see a list of variables you can pull into the page:
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/debugging-and-errors#developer-info>

Just wanted to jump in and provide a bit of clarification (hopefully :slightly_smiling_face: )
• re: swagger specs, we do have them but right now they still require some manual tweaking and updating so they aren’t quite ready to published publicly but it’s very much something we want to do. I’ll just ask for a bit of patience on that one.
• re: fields we do have the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/properties|properties API> to tell you about what properties have been created for any CRM object. Otherwise you will need to refer to the documentation
• re: Postman - we do have downloadable Postman collections for each API. If you see anything off or have any suggestions for improvement let me know, I’m one the that created/maintains those.
I may be wrong here haven’t tested but I believe if you go into page settings and specify a canonical url the HTML meta tag is automatically added through the standard_header_includes.

:this:, the canonical should be added automatically as there is a setting in the <https://app.HubSpot.com/l/settings/website/pages/all-domains/seo-and-crawlers> area that you can control this. Likewise, entering a canonical into that field can overwrite the canonical that is added automatically,

<@UFAANRW07> Yea you can load these fonts any of the same way that you would load a google font - put it in the head. Or you could include it on the template layout for theme but that could easily get a little overwhelming. Likely best to keep it in the settings area so it is included with {{standard_header_includes }}

The only way that I can think of to make it work with themes is to make a boolean that hides the google font picker and then some custom inputs for a choice select that contains the adobe fonts you are importing.

Adobe fonts are not baked into themes in the same way that the google font stack is. --as far as I am aware
Even if I include the adobe fonts in the <head> section, they still do not show up when iterating a module or theme page.
<@UFAANRW07> Are you saying that your fonts are not picking up the correct font family? Or are you trying to integrate it into a selector option of some kind for a content editor to be able to pick?

The first one, although the second scenario would likely be a future outcome. When I include the font from adobe in the <head>, then call upon that font in my CSS either in my _custom.css file, _main.css file, _typography.css, or in the module's CSS section, I am unable to get the font to render.
how are you including it?
Did you check to see if the correct CSS font is actually being loaded on the page? Maybe its being referenced wrong in the CSS? Or is the typekit/font not even loading on the page at all?
